item.title: Why SSH PasswordAuthentication option doesn't work
item.description: After reading the SSH manual, I enabled the PasswordAuthentication in the /etc/ssh/ssh_config on my server. I tried to establish a SSH connection to my server with the command ssh username@hosturl.com. I got this error message: username@hosturl.com: Permission denied (publickey). Apparently, my ssh client was trying to use public key to establish the connection instead of prompting for password. I couldn't find out why the option doesn't work as expected until I tried to list the /etc/ssh/ directory again.
